page.title: 12ATTITUDES IN FROXFIELD.
page.content: During an interview with a key person in the Froxfield Green area, this information was obtained: In the past village life depended on agriculture, but now only 5% of the population do. Basic housing is better (electricity since 1954). The main religion is Church of England & average age of congregation is 40-50. Services are adequate, but the Post Bus is useless so most people have cars (The old 'Wonderbus' was taken out of service). The main issue today is the heavy lorries on Stoner Hill.The area has suffered a lot of rural depopulation, and rates are not too high, but their administration is not efficient. Not many changes are deemed necessary, as the area is one of outstanding natural beauty.
